title: Countries with the fastest growing economies from 2001 to 2010
yAxis: Annual average GDP growth in percent
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Annual average GDP growth in percent for 10 number of Countrys.
The Annual average GDP growth in percent is highest at Country Angola and lowest at Country Rwanda.
The highest value at Country Angola is 1.46x times more than the lowest value at Rwanda.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Annual average GDP growth in percent in the y axis.
The Annual average GDP growth in percent is appeared to be the highest at Country Angola and lowest at Country Rwanda.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Annual average GDP growth in percent for 10 number of Countrys.
The Annual average GDP growth in percent is highest at Country Angola and lowest at Country Rwanda.
The highest value at Country Angola is 1.46x times more than the lowest value at Rwanda.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Annual average GDP growth in percent in the y axis.
The maximum Annual average GDP growth in percent 11.1 is found at Country Angola and the minimum is found at Rwanda where Country is 7.6.
Country China has the second highest value for Annual average GDP growth in percent.
The difference of Annual average GDP growth in percent between the highest and lowest Country is 3.5.
Country Angola is higher than any other Countrys with value 11.1, followed by China, and Myanmar. Down to Country Rwanda with the lowest value 7.6.
Country Chad, and Mozambique share the same value 7.9.
The Country Rwanda tends to be 1.25 percent lower than average.
